wretched:
悲惨的 
very bad or unpleasant
therapeutic:
对身心健康有益的 
producing good effects on your body or mind

治疗的 
of or relating to the treatment of illness
burrow:
挖洞 
to make a hole or tunnel in the ground by digging

洞穴 
a hole or tunnel in the ground that an animal (such as a rabbit or fox) makes to live in or 
for safety
deprecate:
反对 
criticize or express disapproval of (someone or something)
repose:
休息；睡眠；平静；镇静 
a state of rest, sleep or feeling calm

物体 位于；被搁置 
(of an object) to be or be kept in a particular place

人 躺；休息 
(of a person) to lie or rest in a particular place
deject:
使情绪低落 
sad because of failure, loss, etc.
toasty:
暖烘烘的；温暖舒适的 
warm and comfortable
conceptual:
概念上的 
based on or relating to ideas or concepts 
180
intangible:
无形的；难以形容或理解的；不易度量的 
unable to be touched or grasped; not having physical presence; difficult or impossible to 
define or understand; vague and abstract
surge:
激增；急剧上升 
to suddenly increase to an unusually high level
exemplar:
典范 
an admired person or thing that is considered an example that deserves to be copied
vaccinate:
给…接种疫苗 
to give a person or an animal a vaccine, especially by injecting it, in order to protect them 
against a disease
turmoil:
混乱 
a state of confusion or disorder
vicious:
狂暴的；残酷的 
violent and cruel

凶猛的；危险的 
of animals fierce and dangerous 动物

攻击、批评等充满仇恨的；严厉的 
(of an attack, criticism, etc.) full of hatred and anger
filthy:
肮脏的；污秽的 
very dirty and unpleasant

下流的；淫秽的；猥亵的 
very rude and offensive and usually connected with sex
grimace:
鬼脸，怪相 
a facial expression in which your mouth and face are twisted in a way that shows disgust, 
disapproval, or pain
conjunction:
结合，同时发生 
a situation in which two or more things happen at the same time or in the same place
catastrophic:
灾难性的；引起重大灾难的 
involving or causing sudden great damage or suffering
bypass:
旁路，支路 
a road that goes around a blocked or very crowded area

绕开，忽视 
to go around or avoid (a place or area) 
181
rekindle:
使重新活跃 
to cause (something, such as a feeling) to be strong or active again

重新点燃 
to begin to burn again; to flare up again
malice:
恶意；怨恨 
a feeling of hatred for somebody that causes a desire to harm them
domineering:
专横跋扈的 
tending too often to tell people what to do; often trying to control the behavior of others
churn:
搅拌 
to stir or mix something (such as water or mud) with force
embryo:
胚胎 
a human or animal in the early stages of development before it is born, hatched, etc.

初期 
an early or undeveloped stage of something
alight:
下车，落下 
to step down from a boat, vehicle, etc.
irritable:
易怒的；暴躁的 
having or showing a tendency to be easily annoyed or made angry
deferential:
恭敬的 
showing or expressing respect and high regard due a superior or an elder
fleeting:
短暂的；闪现的 
lasting only a short time
introspection:
反省 
the process of examining your own thoughts or feelings
overwrought:
极不高兴的；过于激动的 
very excited or upset
faculty:
才能 
one of the powers of your mind or body

全体教职员 
the group of teachers in a school or college
ravishing:
引人入胜的，令人陶醉的 
very beautiful 
182
transcript:
根据录音或笔记整理的笔录本，转写本 
a written, printed, or typed copy of words that have been spoken

学生成绩报告单 
an official record of a student's grades
spew:
喷出，射出 
to flow out of something in a fast and forceful way
germ:
胚芽，萌芽 
something that can grow to become a whole animal, plant, etc., or one of its parts

病菌 
a very small living thing that causes disease
inherent:
内在的 
belonging to the basic nature of someone or something
counterfeit:
伪造 
to make an exact copy of (something) in order to trick people

伪造的 
made to look like an exact copy of something in order to trick people
necessitate:
使…成为必需 
to make (something) necessary
novice:
新手 
a person who has just started learning or doing something
polymath:
博学家；博学大师 
a person who knows a lot about many different subjects
congenital:
天赋的 
naturally having a specified character

先天性的 
existing since birth
peripheral:
外围的，周边的 
of or relating to the area that is to the side of the area you are looking at

次要的 
not relating to the main or most important part
peril:
危险 
the possibility that you will be hurt or killed or that something unpleasant or bad will 
happen; danger 
183
sewage:
下水道的污水，污物，废水 
waste material (such as human urine and feces) that is carried away from homes and other 
buildings in a system of pipes
succumb_to:
屈从 
to lose the determination to oppose something; to accept defeat
thorny:
棘手的；麻烦的；引起争议的 
causing difficulty or disagreement

有刺的；多刺的 
having thorns
lean:
倚靠 
to bend or move from a straight position

精瘦的 
not having much fat on the body; physically thin, strong, and healthy
underpinning:
基础，基础材料；支撑；支柱 
support, strength, or the basic structure of something foundation
strenuous:
费力的 
requiring or showing great energy and effort
itch:
使发痒 
to have or produce an unpleasant feeling on your skin or inside your mouth, nose, etc. that 
makes you want to scratch

痒 
an uncomfortable or unpleasant feeling on your skin or inside your mouth, nose, etc., that 
makes you want to scratch
nude:
裸的 
having no clothes on; naked
apologist:
辩解者；辩护者 
a person who defends or supports something (such as a religion, cause, or organization) 
that is being criticized or attacked by other people
cuisine:
烹饪；风味 
a style of cooking

通常指昂贵的饭店中的饭菜，菜肴 
the food served in a restaurant (usually an expensive one)
wordy:
冗长的 
using or containing too many words 
184
tapestry:
壁毯；绒绣；织锦；绣帷 
a picture or pattern that is made by weaving coloured wool on to heavy fabric; the art of 
doing this
impenetrable:
无法穿越的 
impossible to pass or see through

难以理解的 
impossible to understand
milieu:
周围环境；社会背景 
a person's social environment
imposition:
强加，过分的要求 
a demand or request that is not reasonable or that causes trouble for someone
withstand:
经受，承受 
to not be harmed or affected by (something)
punctuality:
准时性 
arriving or doing something at the expected or planned time 
185
syntactic:
语法的 
of or relating to syntax
aggrieved:
受害的，受委屈的；愤愤不平的，感到受委屈的 
suffering unfair or illegal treatment and making a complaint; feeling that you have been 
treated unfairly
sieve:
滤勺，笊篱，筛子 
a strainer for separating lumps from powdered material or grading particle

筛，过滤 
put (a food substance or other material) through a sieve in order to remove unwanted items 
or examine in detail
concoction:
古怪或少见的混合物，调合物，调配品尤指饮料或药物 
strange or unusual mixture of things, especially drinks or medicines
squash:
把…压扁；镇压 
crush or squeeze (something) with force so that it becomes flat, soft, or out of shape; to 
stop something from continuing, to destroy something because it is a problem
parameter:
参数 
a rule or limit that controls what something is or how something should be done
dismantle:
拆开 
to take (something, such as a machine or structure) apart so that it is in separate pieces
verisimilitude:
逼真 
the quality of seeming true or of having the appearance of being real
bounty:
丰富，慷慨 
good things that are given or provided freely and in large amounts

尤指为找到或杀死某人而悬赏的赏金，奖金 
an amount of money given to someone as a reward for catching a criminal
compliment:
恭维 赞扬，称赞 
a remark that expresses approval, admiration, or respect
arduous:
费力的，艰巨的 
involving or requiring strenuous effort; difficult and tiring
reckon:
考虑 
to think or suppose (something); to believe that (something) is true or possible 
186
despotism:
专制，暴政 
rule by a despot
gingerly:
谨慎的；小心翼翼的；轻手轻脚的 
in a careful way, because you are afraid of being hurt, of making a noise, etc.
neutral:
中立的 
not supporting either side of an argument, fight, war, etc.
stealthy:
鬼鬼祟祟的 
quiet and secret in order to avoid being noticed
specimen:
标本，样本 
something (such as an animal or plant) collected as an example of a particular kind of thing
subterfuge:
通常指欺骗性的秘密手段，招数；伎俩；花招 
a secret, usually dishonest, way of behaving or doing something
serene:
平静的，宁静的 
calm and peaceful
sprawl:
伸开四肢坐着；摊开四肢躺着 
to lie or sit with your arms and legs spread wide apart

延伸 
to spread or develop in an uneven or uncontrolled way
